member_organisations:
Details on all FH Europe member organisations appear on the FH Europe website: https://fheurope.org/member-organisations/members/ 
Most of the member associations are run on a voluntary basis, a  small number are large enough to have paid staff members, some of whom are employed on a part-time basis.
fields_of_interest: Education and training, Research and innovation, Public Health
eu_initiatives:
We are interested in following European Union health policy relating to cardiovascular disease and lipid disorders,in particular Familial Hypercholesterolaemia (both heterozygous and homozygous) and related lipid conditions such as FCS. This falls within the European Union policy area of non-communicable diseases. 
 
We have not responded to any policy documents at present. 
If policy matters arise affecting cardiovascular disease and/or lipid disorders we plan to write to the relevant decision-makers or officials in the EU and would hope to arrange a meeting or correspond on the subject.
organisation_name: FH Europe - the European FH patient network (FH Europe)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
FH Europe is not a member of any other pan-European body. 
It regularly attends European Atherosclerosis Society conference, either to man a stand or to have a representative(s) as guest patient association speaker. Has also attended European Society of Cardiologists conference.
goals__remit:
The objectives of FH Europe are to actively work to secure early identification and diagnosis of Familial Hypercholesterolaemia (FH) patients to prevent early cardiovascular disease. 
 
Our aims as a patient association are to: 
Share information and best practice across Europe 
Work with experts to focus on themes and topics of interest to the patients and families we represent 
Support development of newer or smaller patient groups and individuals wanting to start a patient group
relevant_communication: In the last year we have not undertaken any visits to Brussels to the European Parliament or the European Commission.
legal_status: Charity registered with the Charity Commission in England and Wales
